text: so today a perennial favorite meatloaf
gets a little bit of well I call it an
upgrade I'm making a cheeseburger but a
bacon cheeseburger version so it has
cheddar cheese in it and then bacon
wrapped around it and it is so good I
definitely think it's an upgrade because
who doesn't want more deliciousness on
their meat hooks which is already let's
be honest pretty delicious you'll need
two onions peeled and minced heat a
skillet over medium-high heat and add
two tablespoons of olive oil until they
start turning golden brown that'll
probably take about I don't know six to
eight minutes depending on the heat of
your so I think I didn't add enough oil
which is shocking considering and now
you can see that they're starting to
turn more evenly golden which is heading
towards caramelizing add a teaspoon of
salt and a half a teaspoon of black
pepper
three tablespoons of Worcestershire
sauce this is going to give plenty of
depth of flavor which is always great
thing to add I add it to a lot of like
marinades and other kinds of sauces
it adds that depth that we really
couldn't get any other way also a
quarter cup of broth azuz chicken rock
and a quarter cup of ketchup
I also need another half a cup of
ketchup for the top so I'm saving that
aside in the bowl and just adding here
stir everything together let the liquid
boil up everything combines and then
needs to cool completely before you add
it to your meat mixture this is two
pounds of 85% lean ground beef so it's
got a good amount of fat which you want
in your meatloaf and the cooled mixture
with the onions and the Worcestershire
sauce and ketchup to that add one egg
you want to beat it first I often just
add it to the ball and beat it in the
ball but it's actually probably better
to do it this way egg 1/2 a cup of
breadcrumbs
and one and a half cups of grated
cheddar cheese sort of a medium sharp
cheddar cheese I actually like the
flavor of extra sharp but it tends to
break a little bit when it cooks you
want something that'll melt to that add
two teaspoons of salt
I'm using kosher salt so if you're using
not kosher salt make sure you use less
half a teaspoon of black pepper and then
mix this all together
let's switch to my hands which is what
the recipe says and it's actually the
best tool for doing this so normally
with meatloaf rum or meatballs recipes
instruct you not to over mix it what we
found to be the case when we were
developing this recipe is yes you don't
want to over mix it because you don't
want to get it to be too tough but you
also don't want to under mix it you just
want to make sure that it actually does
hold together when you bake it and when
you slice it so I think I'm at that
stage I'm gonna bake this on a baking
sheet which is what we found to be the
most delicious way to make the meatloaf
because we found that you got more
browning browning all over it doesn't
steam the way it would in a loaf pan and
we just thought it was more delicious
that way so for firmly press into a loaf
should be about 10 inches long that'll
end up with something about two inches
thick as well
now clean hands half a cup of ketchup
with one tablespoon of light or dark
brown sugar stir together this is your
glaze so in order to get your bacon to
stick you're gonna brush your meatloaf
with about half the glaze so 1/4 cup
approximately not only does that help
the bacon stick but it's also infusing
the meatloaf with the flavor as it bakes
and then drape your bacon over the top I
like to tuck the ends under
lately so it stays on you want enough
bacon that it will cover your meatloaf
completely you can very slightly overlap
it so that there are no gaps and I do
find that in this instance the thinner
bacon works better the thicker bacon
doesn't cook as nicely and doesn't get
as crunchy and delicious as the thinner
bacon so look for the thin cut bacon if
you're if you happen to be the kind of
person that generally tends towards
thick should take about six ounces or
eight slices but it really depends on
how long you make your meatloaf etc I
think mine was a little long so I'm
using a few extra slices got that nice
and cozy in there and then the remaining
glaze goes over the top of the bacon
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
get your meatloaf in the oven and cook
it until it's 165 degrees that will take
55 to 65 minutes depending
when you take your meatloaf out of the
oven make sure to let it rest for at
least 25 minutes so that it has the
chance to reabsorb its juices and cool
off enough that you can slice it and
then you can slice it up and because
it's a cheeseburger version I thought
serving it on a bun would be a great
idea so slice it up get your bun get
your buttons ready a little bit of
lettuce maybe iceberg perfect for this
situation and then the ps/2 resistance
for this is a little bit of russian
dressing certainly you don't need to do
that you could do mustard mayonnaise
more ketchup whatever you like but I'm
going with the combo of all sandwich and
this recipe is so great and it makes
plenty so there's gonna be a lot of
leftovers for you to take to work or eat
for dinner for like you know three nice
drop
enjoy if you like recipes like this and
